issue.title: [CF 606] Inconsistent Opacity on cooldowns
issue.body:
I have a couple of meta icons that show the buff duration followed by the CD.
Opacity is set to 100% for the buff duration and while the CD is available, to 80% while not usable.
Example Rapid fire:

Buff:
^1^T^SType^Sbuff ^SName^S3045 ^SFakeHidden^B ^SShowTimerText^B ^SEnabled^B ^t^N60206^S~`~| ^Sicon^^
CD:
^1^T^SType^Sbuff ^SName^S3045 ^SFakeHidden^B ^SShowTimerText^B ^SEnabled^B ^t^N60206^S~`~| ^Sicon^^

Meta icon:
^1^T^SType^Smeta ^SIcons^T ^N1^STellMeWhen_Group7_Icon5 ^N2^STellMeWhen_Group7_Icon6 ^t^SEnabled^B ^t^N60206^S~`~| ^Sicon^^

The problem occurs once the spell comes off cooldown, the opacity wont change back to 100%.
Tested it with other cooldowns and it doesn't have to be a meta icon normal cooldown tracking works (or rather don't) the same.

On a side note is 80% brighter than before? Used it in the older version and it was paler than now.


> Posted by CurseForge user Banur | Imported from CurseForge issue #606 | Raw

comments.body:
Your buff and cooldown export strings are exactly the same.

But, before responding, please upgrade to the latest alpha (http://wow.curseforge.com/addons/tellmewhen/files/) and see if this fixes the problem. I'm willing to bet that it will.

Edited Sep 11, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

No response received after one week. Closing ticket.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
